member.name: T:TagLib.NonContainer.File
member.summary: This abstract class extends to provide tagging and properties for files that contain an indeterminite number of tags at their beginning or end.

remarks.para: When extending this class, , , and should be overrided methods that read the format specific information from the file.
The file is read upon construction in the following manner:

item.term: The file is opened for reading.
The tags at the start of the file are read.
The tags at the end of the file are read.
If reading with a style other than , is called.

member.name: T:TagLib.File
member.summary: This abstract class provides a basic framework for reading from and writing to a file, as well as accessing basic tagging and media properties.

remarks.para: This class is agnostic to all specific media types. Its child classes, on the other hand, support the the intricacies of different media and tagging formats. For example, supports the MPEG-4 specificication and Apple's tagging format.

Each file type can be created using its format specific constructors, ie. , but the preferred method is to use or one of its variants, as it automatically detects the appropriate class from the file extension or provided mime-type.

member.name: M:TagLib.File.GetTag(TagLib.TagTypes,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Gets a tag of a specified type from the current instance, optionally creating a new tag if possible.
member.param: A value indicating the type of tag to read.
A value specifying whether or not to try and create the tag if one is not found.
member.returns: A object containing the tag that was found in or added to the current instance. If no matching tag was found and none was created, is returned.

remarks.para: Passing to does not guarantee the tag will be created. For example, trying to create an ID3v2 tag on an OGG Vorbis file will always fail.
It is safe to assume that if is not returned, the returned tag can be cast to the appropriate type.

example.para: The following example sets the mood of a file to several tag types.

member.name: M:TagLib.File.GetTag(TagLib.TagTypes)
member.summary: Gets a tag of a specified type from the current instance.
member.param: A value indicating the type of tag to read.
member.returns: A object containing the tag that was found in the current instance. If no matching tag was found, is returned.

remarks.para: This class merely accesses the tag if it exists. provides the option of adding the tag to the current instance if it does not exist.
It is safe to assume that if is not returned, the returned tag can be cast to the appropriate type.

example.para: The following example reads the mood of a file from several tag types.

member.name: T:TagLib.File.FileTypeResolver
member.summary: This delegate is used for intervening in by resolving the file type before any standard resolution operations.
member.param: A object representing the file to be read.
A object containing the mime-type of the file.
A value specifying how to read media properties from the file.
member.returns: A new instance of or if the resolver could not match it.

remarks.para: A is one way of altering the behavior of .
When is called, the registered resolvers are invoked in the reverse order in which they were registered. The resolver may then perform any operations necessary, including other type-finding methods.
If the resolver returns a new , it will instantly be returned, by . If it returns , will continue to process. If the resolver throws an exception it will be uncaught.
To register a resolver, use .

member.param: A value containing the seek position at which the tags end and the media data begins.
A value specifying at what level of accuracy to read the media properties, or to ignore the properties.
member.remarks: This method is called by the constructor immediately after the tags at the start of the file have been read and as such (so the internal seek mechanism is close to the start). It should be used for reading any content specific information, such as an audio header from the start of the file.

member.name: M:TagLib.NonContainer.File.ReadEnd(System.Int64,TagLib.ReadStyle)
member.summary: Reads format specific information at the end of the file.
member.param: A value containing the seek position at which the media data ends and the tags begin.
A value specifying at what level of accuracy to read the media properties, or to ignore the properties.
member.remarks: This method is called by the constructor immediately after the tags at the end of the file have been read and as such (so the internal seek mechanism is close to the end). It should be used for reading any content specific information, such as an audio header from the end of the file.

member.name: M:TagLib.NonContainer.File.ReadProperties(System.Int64,System.Int64,TagLib.ReadStyle)
member.summary: Reads the audio properties from the file represented by the current instance.
member.param: A value containing the seek position at which the tags end and the media data begins.
A value containing the seek position at which the media data ends and the tags begin.
A value specifying at what level of accuracy to read the media properties, or to ignore the properties.
member.returns: A object describing the media properties of the file represented by the current instance.
member.remarks: This method is called ONLY IF the file is constructed with a read style other than , and as such MUST NOT return . It is guaranteed that and will have been called first and this method should be strictly used to perform final processing on already read data.

member.name: M:TagLib.NonContainer.File.Read(TagLib.ReadStyle)
member.summary: Reads the file with a specified read style.
member.param: A value specifying at what level of accuracy to read the media properties, or to ignore the properties.

member.name: T:TagLib.CorruptFileException
member.summary: This class extends and is used to indicate that a file or tag is corrupt.
member.remarks: This exception will be thrown if invalid data interferes with the reading of the file or tag. One common example is in the (legal) downloading of media files with BitTorrent, in which case large portions of the file will contain zeroed bytes.

example.para: Catching an exception when creating a .
example.code:
Imports System Imports TagLib
Public Class ExceptionTest Public Shared Sub Main () Try file As File = File.Create ("partial.mp3") ' Partial download. Catch e As CorruptFileException Console.WriteLine ("That file is corrupt: {0}", e.ToString ()); End Try End Sub End Class

member.name: M:TagLib.Tag.Duplicate(TagLib.Tag,TagLib.Tag,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Copies all standard values from one tag to another, optionally overwriting existing values.
member.param: A object containing the source tag to copy the values from.
A object containing the target tag to copy values to.
A specifying whether or not to copy values over existing one.

remarks.para: This method only copies the most basic values, those contained in this class, between tags. To copy format specific tags, or additional details, additional implementations need to be applied. For example, copying from one to another: foreach (TagLib.Id3v2.Frame frame in old_tag) new_tag.AddFrame (frame);

member.name: M:TagLib.Tag.CopyTo(TagLib.Tag,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Copies the values from the current instance to another , optionally overwriting existing values.
member.param: A object containing the target tag to copy values to.
A specifying whether or not to copy values over existing one.

remarks.para: This method only copies the most basic values when copying between different tag formats, however, if is of the same type as the current instance, more advanced copying may be done. For example, will copy all of its frames to another tag.

member.param: A to check the contents of.

member.name: P:TagLib.Tag.TagTypes
member.summary: Gets the tag types contained in the current instance.
member.value: A bitwise combined containing the tag types contained in the current instance.
member.remarks: For a standard tag, the value should be intuitive. For example, objects have a value of . However, for tags of type may contain multiple or no types.

member.name: P:TagLib.Tag.Title
member.summary: Gets and sets the title for the media described by the current instance.
member.value: A object containing the title for the media described by the current instance or if no value is present.
member.remarks: The title is most commonly the name of the song or episode or a movie title. For example, "Daydream Believer" (a song by the Monkies), "Space Seed" (an episode of Star Trek), or "Harold and Kumar Go To White Castle" (a movie).

member.name: P:TagLib.Tag.TitleSort
member.summary: Gets and sets the sort name for the title of the media described by the current instance.
member.value: A object containing the sort name for the title of the media described by the current instance or if no value is present.
member.remarks: Possibly used to sort compilations, or episodic content.

member.name: P:TagLib.Tag.Performers
member.summary: Gets and sets the performers or artists who performed in the media described by the current instance.
member.value: A containing the performers or artists who performed in the media described by the current instance or an empty array if no value is present.

remarks.para: This field is most commonly called "Artists" in media applications and should be used to represent each of the artists appearing in the media. It can be simple in theform of "The Beatles", or more complicated in the form of "John Lennon, Paul McCartney, George Harrison, Pete Best", depending on the preferences of the listener and the degree to which they organize their media collection.
As the preference of the user may vary, applications should not try to limit the user in what choice they may make.

member.name: P:TagLib.Tag.PerformersSort
member.summary: Gets and sets the sort names of the performers or artists who performed in the media described by the current instance.
member.value: A containing the sort names for the performers or artists who performed in the media described by the current instance, or an empty array if no value is present.

remarks.para: This is used to provide more control over how tracks are sorted. Typical uses are to skip common prefixes or sort by last name. For example, "The Beatles" might be sorted as "Beatles, The".

member.name: P:TagLib.Tag.AlbumArtists
member.summary: Gets and sets the band or artist who is credited in the creation of the entire album or collection containing the media described by the current instance.
member.value: A containing the band or artist who is credited in the creation of the entire album or collection containing the media described by the current instance or an empty array if no value is present.

remarks.para: This field is typically optional but aids in the sorting of compilations or albums with multiple artists. For example, if an album has several artists, sorting by artist will split up the album and sorting by album will split up albums by the same artist. Having a single album artist for an entire album will solve this problem.

As this value is to be used as a sorting key, it should be used with less variation than . Where performers can be broken into muliple artist it is best to stick with a single band name. For example, "The Beatles".

member.name: P:TagLib.Tag.AlbumArtistsSort
member.summary: Gets and sets the sort names for the band or artist who is credited in the creation of the entire album or collection containing the media described by the current instance.
member.value: A containing the sort names for the band or artist who is credited in the creation of the entire album or collection containing the media described by the current instance or an empty array if no value is present.

remarks.para: This field is typically optional but aids in the sorting of compilations or albums with multiple artists. For example, if an album has several artists, sorting by artist will split up the album and sorting by album will split up albums by the same artist. Having a single album artist for an entire album will solve this problem.

As this value is to be used as a sorting key, it should be used with less variation than . Where performers can be broken into muliple artist it is best to stick with a single band name. For example, "Beatles, The".

member.name: P:TagLib.Tag.Composers
member.summary: Gets and sets the composers of the media represented by the current instance.
member.value: A containing the composers of the media represented by the current instance or an empty array if no value is present.

remarks.para: This field represents the composers, song writers, script writers, or persons who claim authorship of the media.

member.name: P:TagLib.Tag.ComposersSort
member.summary: Gets and sets the sort names for the composers of the media represented by the current instance.
member.value: A containing the sort names for the composers of the media represented by the current instance or an empty array if no value is present.

remarks.para: This field is typically optional but aids in the sorting of compilations or albums with multiple Composers.

As this value is to be used as a sorting key, it should be used with less variation than . Where performers can be broken into muliple artist it is best to stick with a single composer. For example, "McCartney, Paul".

member.name: P:TagLib.Tag.Album
member.summary: Gets and sets the album of the media represented by the current instance.
member.value: A object containing the album of the media represented by the current instance or if no value is present.

remarks.para: This field represents the name of the album the media belongs to. In the case of a boxed set, it should be the name of the entire set rather than the individual disc.
For example, "Rubber Soul" (an album by the Beatles), "The Sopranos: Complete First Season" (a boxed set of TV episodes), or "Back To The Future Trilogy" (a boxed set of movies).

member.name: P:TagLib.Tag.AlbumSort
member.summary: Gets and sets the sort names for the Album Title of the media represented by the current instance.
member.value: A containing the sort names for the Album Title of the media represented by the current instance or an empty array if no value is present.

remarks.para: This field is typically optional but aids in the sorting of compilations or albums with Similar Titles.

member.name: P:TagLib.Tag.Comment
member.summary: Gets and sets a user comment on the media represented by the current instance.
member.value: A object containing user comments on the media represented by the current instance or if no value is present.

remarks.para: This field should be used to store user notes and comments. There is no constraint on what text can be stored here, but it should not contain program information.

Because this field contains notes that the user might think of while listening to the media, it may be useful for an application to make this field easily accessible, perhaps even including it in the main interface.

member.name: P:TagLib.Tag.Genres
member.summary: Gets and sets the genres of the media represented by the current instance.
member.value: A containing the genres of the media represented by the current instance or an empty array if no value is present.

remarks.para: This field represents genres that apply to the song or album. This is often used for filtering media.
A list of common audio genres as popularized by ID3v1, are stored in . Additionally, contains video genres as used by DivX.

member.name: P:TagLib.Tag.Year
member.summary: Gets and sets the year that the media represented by the current instance was recorded.
member.value: A containing the year that the media represented by the current instance was created or zero if no value is present.

remarks.para: Years greater than 9999 cannot be stored by most tagging formats and will be cleared if a higher value is set.
Some tagging formats store higher precision dates which will be truncated when this property is set. Format specific implementations are necessary access the higher precision values.

member.name: P:TagLib.Tag.Track
member.summary: Gets and sets the position of the media represented by the current instance in its containing album.
member.value: A containing the position of the media represented by the current instance in its containing album or zero if not specified.

remarks.para: This value should be the same as is listed on the album cover and no more than if is non-zero.

member.name: P:TagLib.Tag.TrackCount
member.summary: Gets and sets the number of tracks in the album containing the media represented by the current instance.
member.value: A containing the number of tracks in the album containing the media represented by the current instance or zero if not specified.

remarks.para: If non-zero, this value should be at least equal to . If is zero, this value should also be zero.

member.name: P:TagLib.Tag.Disc
member.summary: Gets and sets the number of the disc containing the media represented by the current instance in the boxed set.
member.value: A containing the number of the disc containing the media represented by the current instance in the boxed set.

remarks.para: This value should be the same as is number that appears on the disc. For example, if the disc is the first of three, the value should be 1. It should be no more than if is non-zero.

member.name: P:TagLib.Tag.DiscCount
member.summary: Gets and sets the number of discs in the boxed set containing the media represented by the current instance.
member.value: A containing the number of discs in the boxed set containing the media represented by the current instance or zero if not specified.

remarks.para: If non-zero, this value should be at least equal to . If is zero, this value should also be zero.

member.name: P:TagLib.Tag.Lyrics
member.summary: Gets and sets the lyrics or script of the media represented by the current instance.
member.value: A object containing the lyrics or script of the media represented by the current instance or if no value is present.

remarks.para: This field contains a plain text representation of the lyrics or scripts with line breaks and whitespace being the only formatting marks.
Some formats support more advances lyrics, like synchronized lyrics, but those must be accessed using format specific implementations.

member.name: P:TagLib.Tag.Grouping
member.summary: Gets and sets the grouping on the album which the media in the current instance belongs to.
member.value: A object containing the grouping on the album which the media in the current instance belongs to or if no value is present.

remarks.para: This field contains a non-physical grouping to which the track belongs. In classical music, this could be a movement. It could also be parts of a series like "Introduction", "Closing Remarks", etc.

member.name: P:TagLib.Tag.BeatsPerMinute
member.summary: Gets and sets the number of beats per minute in the audio of the media represented by the current instance.
member.value: A containing the number of beats per minute in the audio of the media represented by the current instance, or zero if not specified.

remarks.para: This field is useful for DJ's who are trying to match songs. It should be calculated from the audio or pulled from a database.

member.name: P:TagLib.Tag.Conductor
member.summary: Gets and sets the conductor or director of the media represented by the current instance.
member.value: A object containing the conductor or director of the media represented by the current instance or if no value present.

remarks.para: This field is most useful for organizing classical music and movies.

member.name: P:TagLib.Tag.Copyright
member.summary: Gets and sets the copyright information for the media represented by the current instance.
member.value: A object containing the copyright information for the media represented by the current instance or if no value present.

remarks.para: This field should be used for storing copyright information. It may be useful to show this information somewhere in the program while the media is playing.
Players should not support editing this field, but media creation tools should definitely allow modification.

member.name: P:TagLib.Tag.MusicBrainzArtistId
member.summary: Gets and sets the MusicBrainz Artist ID of the media represented by the current instance.
member.value: A containing the MusicBrainz ArtistID of the media represented by the current instance or an empty array if no value is present.

remarks.para: This field represents the MusicBrainz ArtistID, and is used to uniquely identify a particular Artist of the track.

member.name: P:TagLib.Tag.MusicBrainzReleaseId
member.summary: Gets and sets the MusicBrainz Release ID of the media represented by the current instance.
member.value: A containing the MusicBrainz ReleaseID of the media represented by the current instance or an empty array if no value is present.

remarks.para: This field represents the MusicBrainz ReleaseID, and is used to uniquely identify a particular Release to which this track belongs.

member.name: P:TagLib.Tag.MusicBrainzReleaseArtistId
member.summary: Gets and sets the MusicBrainz Release Artist ID of the media represented by the current instance.
member.value: A containing the MusicBrainz ReleaseArtistID of the media represented by the current instance or an empty array if no value is present.

remarks.para: This field represents the MusicBrainz Release ArtistID, and is used to uniquely identify a particular Album Artist credited with the Album.

member.name: P:TagLib.Tag.MusicBrainzTrackId
member.summary: Gets and sets the MusicBrainz Track ID of the media represented by the current instance.
member.value: A containing the MusicBrainz TrackID of the media represented by the current instance or an empty array if no value is present.

remarks.para: This field represents the MusicBrainz TrackID, and is used to uniquely identify a particular track.

member.name: P:TagLib.Tag.MusicBrainzDiscId
member.summary: Gets and sets the MusicBrainz Disc ID of the media represented by the current instance.
member.value: A containing the MusicBrainz DiscID of the media represented by the current instance or an empty array if no value is present.

remarks.para: This field represents the MusicBrainz DiscID, and is used to uniquely identify the particular Released Media associated with this track.

member.name: P:TagLib.Tag.MusicIpId
member.summary: Gets and sets the MusicIP PUID of the media represented by the current instance.
member.value: A containing the MusicIP PUID of the media represented by the current instance or an empty array if no value is present.

remarks.para: This field represents the MusicIP PUID, and is an acoustic fingerprint identifier. It Identifies what this track "Sounds Like".

member.name: P:TagLib.Tag.AmazonId
member.summary: Gets and sets the Amazon ID of the media represented by the current instance.
member.value: A containing the AmazonID of the media represented by the current instance or an empty array if no value is present.

remarks.para: This field represents the AmazonID, and is used to identify the particular track or album in the Amazon Catalog.

member.name: P:TagLib.Tag.MusicBrainzReleaseStatus
member.summary: Gets and sets the MusicBrainz Release Status of the media represented by the current instance.
member.value: A containing the MusicBrainz ReleaseStatus of the media represented by the current instance or an empty array if no value is present.

remarks.para: This field represents the MusicBrainz ReleaseStatus, and is used to describes how 'official' a Release is. Common Status are: Official, Promotion, Bootleg, Pseudo-release.

member.name: P:TagLib.Tag.MusicBrainzReleaseType
member.summary: Gets and sets the MusicBrainz Release Type of the media represented by the current instance.
member.value: A containing the MusicBrainz ReleaseType of the media represented by the current instance or an empty array if no value is present.

remarks.para: This field represents the MusicBrainz ReleaseType, that describes what kind of release a Release is.. Common Status are: Single, Album, EP, Compilation, Soundtrack, SpokenWord, Interview, Audiobook, Live, Remix, and Other. Careful thought must be given when using this field to decide if a particular track "Is a Compilation".

member.name: P:TagLib.Tag.MusicBrainzReleaseCountry
member.summary: Gets and sets the MusicBrainz Release Country of the media represented by the current instance.
member.value: A containing the MusicBrainz ReleaseCountry of the media represented by the current instance or an empty array if no value is present.

remarks.para: This field represents the MusicBrainz ReleaseCountry, that describes the country in which an album was released. Note that the ReleaseCountry of an album is not necessarily the country in which it was produced. The label itself will typically be more relevant. eg, a release on "Foo Records UK" that has "Made in Austria" printed on it, will likely be a UK release.

member.name: P:TagLib.Tag.Pictures
member.summary: Gets and sets a collection of pictures associated with the media represented by the current instance.
member.value: A containing a collection of pictures associated with the media represented by the current instance or an empty array if none are present.

remarks.para: Typically, this value is used to store an album cover or icon to use for the file, but it is capable of holding any type of image, including pictures of the band, the recording studio, the concert, etc.

member.summary: Reads the tags stored at the start of the file into the current instance.
member.returns: A value indicating the seek position in the file at which the read tags end. This also marks the seek position at which the media begins.

member.summary: Renders the tags contained in the current instance.
member.returns: A object containing the physical representation of the tags stored in the current instance.
member.remarks: The tags are rendered in the order that they are stored in the current instance.

member.summary: Writes the tags contained in the current instance to the beginning of the file that created it, overwriting the existing tags.
member.returns: A value indicating the seek position in the file at which the written tags end. This also marks the seek position at which the media begins.

member.summary: Removes a set of tag types from the current instance.
member.param: A bitwise combined value containing tag types to be removed from the file.
member.remarks: In order to remove all tags from a file, pass as .

member.name: M:TagLib.NonContainer.StartTag.AddTag(TagLib.TagTypes,TagLib.Tag)
member.summary: Adds a tag of a specified type to the current instance, optionally copying values from an existing type.
member.param: A value specifying the type of tag to add to the current instance. At the time of this writing, this is limited to and .
A to copy values from using , or if no tag is to be copied.
member.returns: The object added to the current instance, or if it couldn't be created.
member.remarks: ID3v2 tags are added at the end of the current instance, while other tags are added to the beginning.

member.name: M:TagLib.NonContainer.StartTag.ReadTag(System.Int64@)
member.summary: Reads a tag starting at a specified position and moves the cursor to its start position.
member.param: A value reference specifying at what position the potential tag starts. If a tag is found, this value will be updated to the position at which the found tag ends.
member.returns: A object representing the tag found at the specified position, or if no tag was found.

member.summary: Looks for a tag starting at a specified position and moves the cursor to its start position.

member.returns: A value specifying the type of tag found at the specified position, or if no tag was found.

A object specifying the description to match.
A object specifying the ISO-639-2 language code to match.
A value specifying the text type to match.
A specifying whether or not to create and add a new frame to the tag if a match is not found.
member.returns: A object containing the matching frame, or if a match wasn't found and is .

member.name: M:TagLib.Id3v2.SynchronisedLyricsFrame.GetPreferred(TagLib.Id3v2.Tag,System.String,System.String,TagLib.Id3v2.SynchedTextType)
member.summary: Gets a specified lyrics frame from the specified tag, trying to to match the description and language but accepting an incomplete match.
member.param: A object to search in.
A object specifying the description to match.
A object specifying the ISO-639-2 language code to match.
A value specifying the text type to match.
member.returns: A object containing the matching frame, or if a match wasn't found.

remarks.para: The method tries matching with the following order of precidence:

item.term: The first frame with a matching description, language, and type.
The first frame with a matching description and language.
The first frame with a matching language.
The first frame with a matching description.
The first frame with a matching type.

member.name: T:TagLib.Ogg.Codec.CodecProvider
member.summary: Represents a method capable of checking an Ogg header packet to see it is matches a given codec.
member.param: A object containing an Ogg header packet.
member.returns: A object capable of processing the stream from which the packet was generated; otherwise .

remarks.para: In order to add support for a new Ogg codec in TagLib#, a derivative class of needs to be created. The class then needs to be added to the codec detection system by creating a and registering it with .

A method implementing should read to determine if it's subclass can handle the data. If it can, it should return a new instance of that class, but in no way act upon the data. If the class cannot be used to read the packet, indicates to the system that it needs to try anther codec provider.

member.name: T:TagLib.Id3v2.SynchData

member.remarks: Unsynchronization is designed so that portions of the tag won't be misinterpreted as MPEG audio stream headers by removing the possibility of the synch bytes occuring in the tag.

member.name: M:TagLib.Ogg.Page.OverwriteSequenceNumbers(TagLib.Ogg.File,System.Int64,System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary{System.UInt32,System.Int32})
member.summary: Overwrites all page headers in a file starting at a specified position, shifting the page sequence numbers a set amount.
member.param: A object containing the file to update.
A value specify at what position to start updating.
A object where the key is the serial number of the stream to update and the value is the amount to offset the page sequence numbers in the stream.
member.remarks: When the number of pages in a stream changes, all subsequent pages in the stream need to have their page sequence number update in order to remain valid. Additionally, when the page sequence number changes, the page needs to have its checksum recomputed. This makes for a costly recalculation if large comment data is added.

member.name: T:TagLib.Mpeg4.IsoChunkLargeOffsetBox
member.summary: This class extends to provide an implementation of a ISO/IEC 14496-12 ChunkLargeOffsetBox.
member.remarks: and contain offsets of media data within the file. As such, if the file changes by even one byte, these values are devalidatated and the box will have to be overwritten to maintain playability.

member.summary: Gets a tag of a specified type from the current instance, optionally creating a new tag if possible.
member.param: A value indicating the type of tag to read.
A value specifying whether or not to try and create the tag if one is not found.
member.returns: A object containing the tag that was found in or added to the current instance. If no matching tag was found and none was created, is returned.
member.remarks: If a is added to the current instance, it will be placed at the start of the file. On the other hand, will be added to the end of the file. All other tag types will be ignored.

member.name: P:TagLib.ByteVector.UseBrokenLatin1Behavior
member.summary: Gets and sets whether or not to use a broken behavior for Latin-1 strings, common to ID3v1 and ID3v2 tags.
member.value: if the broken behavior is to be used. Otherwise, .

remarks.para: Many media players and taggers incorrectly treat Latin-1 fields as "default encoding" fields. As such, a tag may end up with Windows-1250 encoded text. While this problem would be apparent when moving a file from one computer to another, it would not be apparent on the original machine. By setting this property to , your program will behave like Windows Media Player and others, who read tags with this broken behavior.
Please note that TagLib# stores tag data in Unicode formats at every possible instance to avoid these problems in tags it has written.

member.name: T:TagLib.Id3v2.FrameFactory
member.summary: This static class performs the necessary operations to determine and create the correct child class of for a given raw ID3v2 frame.
member.remarks: By default, will only load frames contained in the library. To add additional frames to the process, register a frame creator with .

member.name: F:TagLib.Id3v2.FrameFactory.frame_creators
member.summary: Contains registered frame creators.

member.name: M:TagLib.Id3v2.FrameFactory.CreateFrame(TagLib.ByteVector,System.Int32@,System.Byte,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Creates a object by reading it from raw ID3v2 frame data.
member.param: A object containing a raw ID3v2 frame.
A value reference specifying at what index in at which the frame begins. After reading, it contains the offset of the next frame to be read.
A value specifying the ID3v2 version the frame in is encoded in.
A value specifying whether the entire tag has already been unsynchronized.
member.returns: A object read from the data, or if none is found.
member.exception: The frame contained in the raw data could not be converted to ID3v2 or uses encryption or compression.

member.name: M:TagLib.Id3v2.FrameFactory.AddFrameCreator(TagLib.Id3v2.FrameFactory.FrameCreator)
member.summary: Adds a curstom frame creator to try before using standard frame creation methods.
member.param: A delegate to be used by the frame factory.
member.remarks: Frame creators are used before standard methods so custom checking can be used and new formats can be added. They are executed in the reverse order in which they are added.

member.name: T:TagLib.Id3v2.FrameFactory.FrameCreator
member.summary: Creates a frame from a specified block of data, or returns if unsupported.
member.param: A object containing a raw ID3v2 frame.
A value specifying the offset in at which the frame data begins.
A object for the frame contained in .
A specifying the version of ID3v2 the raw frame data is stored in.
member.returns: A object if the method was able to match and create one. Otherwise .

remarks.para: Frame creators are used to provide access or support for items that are left out of TagLib#.

member.name: P:TagLib.Riff.DivXTag.Title
member.summary: Gets and sets the title for the media described by the current instance.
member.value: A object containing the title for the media described by the current instance or if no value is present.
member.remarks: When stored on disk, only the first 32 bytes of the Latin-1 encoded value will be stored. This may result in lost data.

member.name: P:TagLib.Riff.DivXTag.Performers
member.summary: Gets and sets the performers or artists who performed in the media described by the current instance.
member.value: A containing the performers or artists who performed in the media described by the current instance or an empty array if no value is present.
member.remarks: When stored on disk, only the first 28 bytes of the Latin-1 encoded value will be stored, minus a byte for each additionial performer (i.e. two performers will only have 27 bytes and three performers will only have 26 bytes).This may result in lost data.

member.name: P:TagLib.Riff.DivXTag.Comment
member.summary: Gets and sets a user comment on the media represented by the current instance.
member.value: A object containing user comments on the media represented by the current instance or if no value is present.
member.remarks: When stored on disk, only the first 48 bytes of the Latin-1 encoded value will be stored. This may result in lost data.

member.name: P:TagLib.Riff.DivXTag.Genres
member.summary: Gets and sets the genres of the media represented by the current instance.
member.value: A containing the genres of the media represented by the current instance or an empty array if no value is present.
member.remarks: Only first genre will be stored and only if it is an exact match for a value appearing in . All other values will result in the property being cleared.

member.name: P:TagLib.Riff.DivXTag.Year
member.summary: Gets and sets the year that the media represented by the current instance was recorded.
member.value: A containing the year that the media represented by the current instance was created or zero if no value is present.
member.remarks: Only values between 1 and 9999 will be stored, all other values will result in the property being zeroed.

member.name: T:TagLib.Mpeg4.BoxType
member.summary: provides references to different box types used by the library.

remarks.para: This class is used to severely reduce the number of times these types are created in , greatly improving the speed at which warm files are read.

The reason it is marked as internal is because I'm not sure I like the way the fields are named, and it is really unneccessary for external uses. While the library may use DataBoxes (BoxType.Gen, BoxType.Gnre);, an external user could use tag.DataBoxes ("gen", "gnre"); with the same result.

member.summary: This static class provides a mechanism for registering file classes and mime-types, to be used when constructing a class via .

remarks.para: The default types built into the taglib-sharp.dll assembly are registered automatically when the class is initialized. To register your own custom types, use .

member.name: F:TagLib.FileTypes.static_file_types
member.summary: Contains a static array of file types contained in the TagLib# assembly.
member.remarks: A static Type array is used instead of getting types by reflecting the executing assembly as Assembly.GetTypes is very inefficient and leaks every type instance under Mono. Not reflecting taglib-sharp.dll saves about 120KB of heap.

member.name: T:TagLib.Id3v2.FrameType
member.summary: provides references to different frame types used by the library.

remarks.para: This class is used to severely reduce the number of times these types are created in , greatly improving the speed at which warm files are read. It is, however, not necessary for external users to use this class. While the library may use GetTextAsString (FrameType.TIT2); an external user could use tag.GetTextAsString ("TIT2"); with the same result.

member.name: T:TagLib.Id3v2.PlayCountFrame
member.summary: This class extends , implementing support for ID3v2 Play Count (PCNT) Frames.

example.para: Getting and incrementing the play count of a file.
example.code:
Imports TagLib Imports TagLib.Id3v2
Public Shared Class TrackUtil Public Shared Sub GetPlayCount (filename As String) As Integer Dim file As File = File.Create (filename, ReadStyle.None) Dim tag As Id3v2.Tag = file.GetTag (TagTypes.Id3v2, False) If tag Is Nothing Then Return 0
Dim frame As PlayCountFrame = PlayCountFrame.Get (tag, False) If frame Is Nothing Then Return 0
Return frame.PlayCount End Sub
Public Shared Sub IncrementPlayCount (filename As String) Dim file As File = File.Create (filename, ReadStyle.None) Dim tag As Id3v2.Tag = file.GetTag (TagTypes.Id3v2, True) If tag Is Nothing Then Exit Sub
PlayCountFrame.Get (tag, True).PlayCount += 1 file.Save () End Sub End Class

import TagLib import TagLib.Id3v2
public static class TrackUtil: static def GetPlayCount (filename as string) as int: file As File = File.Create (filename, ReadStyle.None) tag as Id3v2.Tag = file.GetTag (TagTypes.Id3v2, false) if tag == null: return 0
frame as PlayCountFrame = PlayCountFrame.Get (tag, false) if frame == null: return 0
return frame.PlayCount
static def IncrementPlayCount (filename as string): file as File = File.Create (filename, ReadStyle.None) tag as Id3v2.Tag = file.GetTag (TagTypes.Id3v2, True) if tag == null: return
PlayCountFrame.Get (tag, true).PlayCount ++ file.Save ()

member.name: T:TagLib.Aiff.StreamHeader
member.summary: This struct implements to provide support for reading Apple's AIFF stream properties.

member.name: F:TagLib.Aiff.StreamHeader.Size
member.summary: The size of an AIFF Common chunk

member.name: F:TagLib.Aiff.StreamHeader.channels
member.summary: Contains the number of channels.
member.remarks: This value is stored in bytes (9,10). 1 is monophonic, 2 is stereo, 4 means 4 channels, etc.. any number of audio channels may be represented

member.name: F:TagLib.Aiff.StreamHeader.total_frames
member.summary: Contains the number of sample frames in the Sound Data chunk.
member.remarks: This value is stored in bytes (11-14).

member.name: F:TagLib.Aiff.StreamHeader.bits_per_sample
member.summary: Contains the number of bits per sample.
member.remarks: This value is stored in bytes (15,16). It can be any number from 1 to 32.

member.name: F:TagLib.Aiff.StreamHeader.sample_rate
member.summary: Contains the sample rate.
member.remarks: This value is stored in bytes (17-26). the sample rate at which the sound is to be played back, in sample frames per second

member.name: F:TagLib.Aiff.StreamHeader.stream_length
member.summary: Contains the length of the audio stream.
member.remarks: This value is provided by the constructor.

member.name: F:TagLib.Aiff.StreamHeader.FileIdentifier
member.summary: The identifier used to recognize a AIFF file. Altough an AIFF file start with "FORM2, we're interested in the Common chunk only, which contains the properties we need.
member.value: "COMM"

member.summary: Constructs and initializes a new instance of for a specified header block and stream length.
member.param: A object containing the stream header data.
A value containing the length of the AIFF Audio stream in bytes.

member.value: A containing the duration of the media represented by the current instance.

member.summary: Gets the types of media represented by the current instance.
member.value: Always .

member.value: A object containing a description of the media represented by the current instance.

member.value: A value containing a bitrate of the audio represented by the current instance.

member.value: A value containing the sample rate of the audio represented by the current instance.

member.name: T:TagLib.SupportedMimeType
member.summary: This class provides an attribute for listing supported mime-types for classes that extend .
member.remarks: When classes that extend are registered with , its attributes are read.

member.name: F:TagLib.SupportedMimeType.mimetypes
member.summary: Contains the registered objects.

member.name: F:TagLib.SupportedMimeType.mimetype
member.summary: Contains the mime-type.

member.name: F:TagLib.SupportedMimeType.extension
member.summary: Contains the extension.

member.name: M:TagLib.SupportedMimeType.#cctor
member.summary: Constructs and initializes the class by initializing the class.

member.name: M:TagLib.SupportedMimeType.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Constructs and initializes a new instance of the attribute for a specified mime-type.
member.param: A object containing a standard mime-type.

remarks.para: Standard practice is to use to register standard mime-types, like "audio/mp3" and "video/mpeg" and to use strictly to register extensions, using "taglib/ext" for the mime type. Eg. SupportedMimeType("taglib/mp3", "mp3").

member.name: M:TagLib.SupportedMimeType.#ctor(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Constructs and initializes a new instance of the attribute for a specified mime-type and extension.
member.param: A object containing a standard mime-type.
A object containing a file extension.

remarks.para: Standard practice is to use to register standard mime-types, like "audio/mp3" and "video/mpeg" and to use strictly to register extensions, using "taglib/ext" for the mime type. Eg. SupportedMimeType("taglib/mp3", "mp3").

member.name: P:TagLib.SupportedMimeType.MimeType
member.summary: Gets the mime-type registered by the current instance.
member.value: A object containing the mime-type registered by the current instance.

remarks.para: The value is in the format "generic/specific". For example, "video/mp4".

member.name: P:TagLib.SupportedMimeType.Extension
member.summary: Gets the extension registered by the current instance.
member.value: A object containing the extension registered by the current instance, or if not specified.

remarks.para: The value is the file extension minus the preceding ".". For example, "m4v".

member.name: P:TagLib.SupportedMimeType.AllMimeTypes
member.summary: Gets all the mime-types that have been registered with .
member.value: A object containing all the mime-types that have been registered with .

remarks.para: These values are used by to match file types.

member.name: P:TagLib.SupportedMimeType.AllExtensions
member.summary: Gets all the extensions that have been registered with .
member.value: A object containing all the extensions that have been registered with .

remarks.para: These values are currently not used in file type recognition.

member.summary: The audio is compressed at a normal level.

member.summary: The audio is highly compressed.

member.name: T:TagLib.Ape.StreamHeader
member.summary: This struct implements to provide support for reading Monkey's Audio APE stream properties.

member.name: F:TagLib.Ape.StreamHeader.Size
member.summary: The size of a Monkey Audio header.

member.name: F:TagLib.Ape.StreamHeader.version
member.summary: Contains the APE version.
member.remarks: This value is stored in bytes (4,5) of the file and is 1000 times the actual version number, so 3810 indicates version 3.81.

member.name: F:TagLib.Ape.StreamHeader.compression_level
member.summary: Contains the compression level.
member.remarks: This value is stored in bytes (51,52).

member.name: F:TagLib.Ape.StreamHeader.blocks_per_frame
member.summary: Contains the number of audio blocks in one frame.
member.remarks: This value is stored in bytes (55-58).

member.name: F:TagLib.Ape.StreamHeader.final_frame_blocks
member.summary: Contains the number of audio blocks in the final frame.
member.remarks: This value is stored in bytes (59-62).

member.name: F:TagLib.Ape.StreamHeader.total_frames
member.summary: Contains the total number of frames.
member.remarks: This value is stored in bytes (63-66).

member.name: F:TagLib.Ape.StreamHeader.bits_per_sample
member.summary: Contains the number of bits per sample.
member.remarks: This value is stored in bytes (67,68) and is typically 16.

member.name: F:TagLib.Ape.StreamHeader.channels
member.summary: Contains the number of channels.
member.remarks: This value is stored in bytes (69,70) and is typically 1 or 2.

member.name: F:TagLib.Ape.StreamHeader.sample_rate
member.summary: Contains the sample rate.
member.remarks: This value is stored in bytes (71-74) and is typically 44100.

member.name: F:TagLib.Ape.StreamHeader.stream_length
member.summary: Contains the length of the audio stream.
member.remarks: This value is provided by the constructor.

member.name: F:TagLib.Ape.StreamHeader.FileIdentifier
member.summary: The identifier used to recognize a WavPack file.
member.value: "MAC "

member.name: P:TagLib.Id3v1.Tag.Title
member.summary: Gets and sets the title for the media described by the current instance.
member.value: A object containing the title for the media described by the current instance or if no value is present.
member.remarks: When stored on disk, only the first 30 bytes of the Latin-1 encoded value will be stored. This may result in lost data.

member.name: P:TagLib.Id3v1.Tag.Performers
member.summary: Gets and sets the performers or artists who performed in the media described by the current instance.
member.value: A containing the performers or artists who performed in the media described by the current instance or an empty array if no value is present.
member.remarks: When stored on disk, only the first 30 bytes of the Latin-1 encoded value will be stored, minus a byte for each additionial performer (i.e. two performers will only have 29 bytes and three performers will only have 28 bytes).This may result in lost data.

member.name: P:TagLib.Id3v1.Tag.Album
member.summary: Gets and sets the album of the media represented by the current instance.
member.value: A object containing the album of the media represented by the current instance or if no value is present.
member.remarks: When stored on disk, only the first 30 bytes of the Latin-1 encoded value will be stored. This may result in lost data.

member.name: P:TagLib.Id3v1.Tag.Comment
member.summary: Gets and sets a user comment on the media represented by the current instance.
member.value: A object containing user comments on the media represented by the current instance or if no value is present.
member.remarks: When stored on disk, only the first 28 bytes of the Latin-1 encoded value will be stored. This may result in lost data.

member.name: P:TagLib.Id3v1.Tag.Genres
member.summary: Gets and sets the genres of the media represented by the current instance.
member.value: A containing the genres of the media represented by the current instance or an empty array if no value is present.
member.remarks: Only first genre will be stored and only if it is an exact match for a value appearing in . All other values will result in the property being cleared.

member.name: P:TagLib.Id3v1.Tag.Year
member.summary: Gets and sets the year that the media represented by the current instance was recorded.
member.value: A containing the year that the media represented by the current instance was created or zero if no value is present.
member.remarks: Only values between 1 and 9999 will be stored, all other values will result in the property being zeroed.

member.name: P:TagLib.Id3v1.Tag.Track
member.summary: Gets and sets the position of the media represented by the current instance in its containing album.
member.value: A containing the position of the media represented by the current instance in its containing album or zero if not specified.
member.remarks: Only values between 1 and 255 will be stored, all other values will result in the property being zeroed.

member.name: T:TagLib.Id3v2.PrivateFrame
member.summary: This class extends , implementing support for ID3v2 Private (PRIV) Frames.

remarks.para: A should be used for storing values specific to the application that cannot or should not be stored in another frame type.

example.para: Serializing a database entry and storing it in a private field.
example.code:
Imports System Imports System.IO Imports System.Runtime.Serialization Imports System.Text Imports System.Xml.Serialization Imports TagLib.Id3v2
Public Shared Class DbUtil Public Shared Sub StoreDatabaseEntry (tag As Tag, dbEntry As ISerializable) Dim data As New StringWriter (New StringBuilder ()) Dim serializer As New XmlSerializer (dbEntry.GetType ()) serializer.Serialize (data, dbEntry) Dim frame As PrivateFrame = PrivateFrame.Get (tag, "org.MyProgram.DatabaseEntry", True) frame.PrivateData = Encoding.UTF8.GetBytes (data.ToString ()) End Sub
Public Shared Sub GetDatabaseEntry (tag As Tag, type As Type) Dim frame As PrivateFrame = PrivateFrame.Get (tag, "org.MyProgram.DatabaseEntry", False) If frame Is Nothing Then Return Nothing
Dim serializer As XmlSerializer = New XmlSerializer (type) Return serializer.Deserialize (New MemoryStream (frame.PrivateData)) End Sub End Class

import System import System.IO import System.Runtime.Serialization import System.Text import System.Xml.Serialization import TagLib.Id3v2
public static class DbUtil: static def StoreDatabaseEntry (tag as Tag, dbEntry as ISerializable): data as StringWriter = StringWriter (StringBuilder ()) serializer as XmlSerializer = XmlSerializer (dbEntry.GetType ()) serializer.Serialize (data, dbEntry) frame as PrivateFrame = PrivateFrame.Get (tag, "org.MyProgram.DatabaseEntry", true) frame.PrivateData = Encoding.UTF8.GetBytes (data.ToString ())
static def GetDatabaseEntry (tag As Tag, type As Type): frame as PrivateFrame = PrivateFrame.Get (tag, "org.MyProgram.DatabaseEntry", false) if frame == null: return null
serializer as XmlSerializer = XmlSerializer (type) return serializer.Deserialize (MemoryStream (frame.PrivateData))

Imports System Imports TagLib

member.name: T:TagLib.Mpeg4.IsoChunkOffsetBox
member.summary: This class extends to provide an implementation of a ISO/IEC 14496-12 ChunkOffsetBox.
member.remarks: and contain offsets of media data within the file. As such, if the file changes by even one byte, these values are devalidatated and the box will have to be overwritten to maintain playability.

member.name: T:TagLib.Id3v2.TextInformationFrame
member.summary: This class extends to provide support ID3v2 Text Information Frames (Section 4.2), covering "T000" to "TZZZ", excluding "TXXX".

remarks.para: Text Information Frames contain the most commonly used values in tagging, including the artist, the track name, and just about any value that can be expressed as text.
The following table contains types and descriptions as found in the ID3 2.4.0 native frames specification. (Copyright (C) Martin Nilsson 2000.)

item.description: The 'Content group description' frame is used if the sound belongs to a larger category of sounds/music. For example, classical music is often sorted in different musical sections (e.g. "Piano Concerto", "Weather - Hurricane").
The 'Title/Songname/Content description' frame is the actual name of the piece (e.g. "Adagio", "Hurricane Donna").
The 'Subtitle/Description refinement' frame is used for information directly related to the contents title (e.g. "Op. 16" or "Performed live at Wembley").
The 'Album/Movie/Show title' frame is intended for the title of the recording (or source of sound) from which the audio in the file is taken.

The 'Original album/movie/show title' frame is intended for the title of the original recording (or source of sound), if for example the music in the file should be a cover of a previously released song.

The 'Track number/Position in set' frame is a numeric string containing the order number of the audio-file on its original recording. This MAY be extended with a "/" character and a numeric string containing the total number of tracks/elements on the original recording. E.g. "4/9".

The 'Part of a set' frame is a numeric string that describes which part of a set the audio came from. This frame is used if the source described in the "TALB" frame is divided into several mediums, e.g. a double CD. The value MAY be extended with a "/" character and a numeric string containing the total number of parts in the set. E.g. "1/2".
The 'Set subtitle' frame is intended for the subtitle of the part of a set this track belongs to.
The 'ISRC' frame should contain the International Standard Recording Code [ISRC] (12 characters).
The 'Lead artist/Lead performer/Soloist/Performing group' is used for the main artist.
The 'Band/Orchestra/Accompaniment' frame is used for additional information about the performers in the recording.
The 'Conductor' frame is used for the name of the conductor.
The 'Interpreted, remixed, or otherwise modified by' frame contains more information about the people behind a remix and similar interpretations of another existing piece.
The 'Original artist/performer' frame is intended for the performer of the original recording, if for example the music in the file should be a cover of a previously released song.
The 'Lyricist/Text writer' frame is intended for the writer of the text or lyrics in the recording.
The 'Original lyricist/text writer' frame is intended for the text writer of the original recording, if for example the music in the file should be a cover of a previously released song.
The 'Composer' frame is intended for the name of the composer.

The 'Musician credits list' is intended as a mapping between instruments and the musician that played it. Every odd field is an instrument and every even is an artist or a comma delimited list of artists.
The 'Involved people list' is very similar to the musician credits list, but maps between functions, like producer, and names.
The 'Encoded by' frame contains the name of the person or organisation that encoded the audio file. This field may contain a copyright message, if the audio file also is copyrighted by the encoder.
The 'BPM' frame contains the number of beats per minute in the main part of the audio. The BPM is an integer and represented as a numerical string.
The 'Length' frame contains the length of the audio file in milliseconds, represented as a numeric string.

The 'Initial key' frame contains the musical key in which the sound starts. It is represented as a string with a maximum length of three characters. The ground keys are represented with "A","B","C","D","E", "F" and "G" and halfkeys represented with "b" and "#". Minor is represented as "m", e.g. "Dbm". Off key is represented with an "o" only.

The 'Language' frame should contain the languages of the text or lyrics spoken or sung in the audio. The language is represented with three characters according to ISO-639-2. If more than one language is used in the text their language codes should follow according to the amount of their usage.

The 'Content type', which ID3v1 was stored as a one byte numeric value only, is now a string. You may use one or several of the ID3v1 types as numerical strings, or, since the category list would be impossible to maintain with accurate and up to date categories, define your own.
The 'File type' frame indicates which type of audio this tag defines. (See the specification for more details.)
The 'Media type' frame describes from which media the sound originated. (See the specification for more details.)
The 'Mood' frame is intended to reflect the mood of the audio with a few keywords, e.g. "Romantic" or "Sad".

The 'Copyright message' frame, in which the string must begin with a year and a space character (making five characters), is intended for the copyright holder of the original sound, not the audio file itself. The absence of this frame means only that the copyright information is unavailable or has been removed, and must not be interpreted to mean that the audio is public domain. Every time this field is displayed the field must be preceded with "Copyright " (C) " ", where (C) is one character showing a C in a circle.

The 'Produced notice' frame, in which the string must begin with a year and a space character (making five characters), is intended for the production copyright holder of the original sound, not the audio file itself. The absence of this frame means only that the production copyright information is unavailable or has been removed, and must not be interpreted to mean that the audio is public domain. Every time this field is displayed the field must be preceded with "Produced " (P) " ", where (P) is one character showing a P in a circle.
The 'Publisher' frame simply contains the name of the label or publisher.
The 'File owner/licensee' frame contains the name of the owner or licensee of the file and it's contents.
The 'Internet radio station name' frame contains the name of the internet radio station from which the audio is streamed.
The 'Internet radio station owner' frame contains the name of the owner of the internet radio station from which the audio is streamed.
The 'Original filename' frame contains the preferred filename for the file, since some media doesn't allow the desired length of the filename. The filename is case sensitive and includes its suffix.

The 'Playlist delay' defines the numbers of milliseconds of silence that should be inserted before this audio. The value zero indicates that this is a part of a multifile audio track that should be played continuously.
The 'Encoding time' frame contains a timestamp describing when the audio was encoded. Timestamp format is described in the ID3v2 structure document.
The 'Original release time' frame contains a timestamp describing when the original recording of the audio was released. Timestamp format is described in the ID3v2 structure document.
The 'Recording time' frame contains a timestamp describing when the audio was recorded. Timestamp format is described in the ID3v2 structure document.
The 'Release time' frame contains a timestamp describing when the audio was first released. Timestamp format is described in the ID3v2 structure document.
The 'Tagging time' frame contains a timestamp describing then the audio was tagged. Timestamp format is described in the ID3v2 structure document.

The 'Software/Hardware and settings used for encoding' frame includes the used audio encoder and its settings when the file was encoded. Hardware refers to hardware encoders, not the computer on which a program was run.

The 'Album sort order' frame defines a string which should be used instead of the album name (TALB) for sorting purposes. E.g. an album named "A Soundtrack" might preferably be sorted as "Soundtrack".
The 'Performer sort order' frame defines a string which should be used instead of the performer (TPE2) for sorting purposes.
The 'Title sort order' frame defines a string which should be used instead of the title (TIT2) for sorting purposes.

member.name: T:TagLib.NonContainer.EndTag
member.summary: This class extends , providing support for accessing and modifying a collection of tags appearing at the end of a file.

remarks.para: This class is used by to read all the tags appearing at the end of the file but could be used by other classes. It currently supports ID3v1, ID3v2, and APE tags.

member.name: F:TagLib.NonContainer.EndTag.file
member.summary: Contains the file to operate on.

member.name: F:TagLib.NonContainer.EndTag.read_size
member.summary: Contains the number of bytes that must be read to hold all applicable indicators.

member.name: M:TagLib.NonContainer.EndTag.#ctor(TagLib.File)
member.summary: Constructs and initializes a new instance of for a specified .
member.param: A object on which the new instance will perform its operations.
member.remarks: Constructing a new instance does not automatically read the contents from the disk. must be called to read the tags.

member.name: M:TagLib.NonContainer.EndTag.Read
member.summary: Reads the tags stored at the end of the file into the current instance.
member.returns: A value indicating the seek position in the file at which the read tags begin. This also marks the seek position at which the media ends.

member.name: M:TagLib.NonContainer.EndTag.Render
member.summary: Renders the tags contained in the current instance.
member.returns: A object containing the physical representation of the tags stored in the current instance.
member.remarks: The tags are rendered in the order that they are stored in the current instance.

member.name: M:TagLib.NonContainer.EndTag.Write
member.summary: Writes the tags contained in the current instance to the end of the file that created it, overwriting the existing tags.
member.returns: A value indicating the seek position in the file at which the written tags begin. This also marks the seek position at which the media ends.

member.name: M:TagLib.NonContainer.EndTag.RemoveTags(TagLib.TagTypes)
member.summary: Removes a set of tag types from the current instance.
member.param: A bitwise combined value containing tag types to be removed from the file.
member.remarks: In order to remove all tags from a file, pass as .

member.name: M:TagLib.NonContainer.EndTag.AddTag(TagLib.TagTypes,TagLib.Tag)
member.summary: Adds a tag of a specified type to the current instance, optionally copying values from an existing type.
member.param: A value specifying the type of tag to add to the current instance. At the time of this writing, this is limited to , , and .
A to copy values from using , or if no tag is to be copied.
member.returns: The object added to the current instance, or if it couldn't be created.
member.remarks: ID3v2 tags are added at the end of the current instance, while other tags are added to the beginning.

member.name: M:TagLib.NonContainer.EndTag.ReadTag(System.Int64@)
member.summary: Reads a tag ending at a specified position and moves the cursor to its start position.
member.param: A value reference specifying at what position the potential tag ends at. If a tag is found, this value will be updated to the position at which the found tag starts.
member.returns: A object representing the tag found at the specified position, or if no tag was found.

member.name: M:TagLib.NonContainer.EndTag.ReadTagInfo(System.Int64@)
member.summary: Looks for a tag ending at a specified position and moves the cursor to its start position.
member.param: A value reference specifying at what position the potential tag ends. If a tag is found, this value will be updated to the position at which the found tag starts.
member.returns: A value specifying the type of tag found at the specified position, or if no tag was found.

member.summary: Gets the total size of the tags located at the end of the file by reading from the file.

member.name: T:TagLib.Mpeg.File
member.summary: This class extends to provide tagging and properties support for MPEG-1, MPEG-2, and MPEG-2.5 video files.
member.remarks: A and will be added automatically to any file that doesn't contain one. This change does not effect the file until it is saved and can be reversed using the following method: file.RemoveTags (file.TagTypes & ~file.TagTypesOnDisk);

member.summary: Gets a tag of a specified type from the current instance, optionally creating a new tag if possible.

A value specifying whether or not to try and create the tag if one is not found.
member.returns: A object containing the tag that was found in or added to the current instance. If no matching tag was found and none was created, is returned.
member.remarks: If a is added to the current instance, it will be placed at the start of the file. On the other hand, will be added to the end of the file. All other tag types will be ignored.

member.name: M:TagLib.Mpeg.File.ReadSystemFile(System.Int64)
member.summary: Reads the contents of the file as a system file, starting at a specified position.
member.param: A value specifying the postion in the file represented by the current instance at which to start reading.
member.remarks: This method will stop when it has read both an audio and a video header, or once it's read 100 packets. This is to prevent the entire file from being read if it lacks one type of stream.

member.name: M:TagLib.Mpeg.File.ReadAudioPacket(System.Int64@)
member.summary: Reads an audio packet, assigning the audio header and advancing the position to the next packet position.
member.param: A value reference specifying the position at which to start reading the packet. This value is updated to the position of the next packet.

member.name: M:TagLib.Mpeg.File.ReadVideoPacket(System.Int64@)
member.summary: Reads a video packet, assigning the video header and advancing the position to the next packet position.
member.param: A value reference specifying the position at which to start reading the packet. This value is updated to the position of the next packet.

member.name: M:TagLib.Mpeg.File.ReadSystemSyncPacket(System.Int64@)
member.summary: Reads a system sync packet, filling in version information and the first timestamp value, advancing the position to the next packet position.

member.name: T:TagLib.Mpeg.AudioFile
member.summary: This class extends to provide tagging and properties support for MPEG-1, MPEG-2, and MPEG-2.5 audio files.
member.remarks: A and will be added automatically to any file that doesn't contain one. This change does not effect the file until it is saved and can be reversed using the following method: file.RemoveTags (file.TagTypes & ~file.TagTypesOnDisk);

member.summary: Gets a tag of a specified type from the current instance, optionally creating a new tag if possible.
member.param: A value indicating the type of tag to read.
A value specifying whether or not to try and create the tag if one is not found.
member.returns: A object containing the tag that was found in or added to the current instance. If no matching tag was found and none was created, is returned.
member.remarks: If a is added to the current instance, it will be placed at the start of the file. On the other hand, will be added to the end of the file. All other tag types will be ignored.

A value specifying at what level of accuracy to read the media properties, or to ignore the properties.
member.remarks: This method only searches for an audio header in the first 16384 bytes of code to avoid searching forever in corrupt files.

member.name: T:TagLib.Id3v2.MusicCdIdentifierFrame
member.summary: This class extends , implementing support for ID3v2 Music CD Identifier (MCDI) Frames.
member.remarks: Music CD Identifier Frames should contain the table of contents data as stored on the physical CD. It is primarily used for track information lookup by through web sources like CDDB.

example.para: Reading the music CD identifier from a tag.
example.code:
Imports TagLib Imports TagLib.Id3v2
Public Shared Class LookupUtil Public Shared Sub GetCdIdentifier (filename As String) As TagLib.ByteVector Dim file As File = File.Create (filename, ReadStyle.None) Dim tag As Id3v2.Tag = file.GetTag (TagTypes.Id3v2, False) If tag Is Nothing Return New ByteVector ()
Dim frame As MusicCdIdentifierFrame = MusicCdIdentifierFrame.Get (tag, False) If frame Is Nothing Return New ByteVector ()
Return frame.Data End Sub End Class

member.name: T:TagLib.Id3v2.CommentsFrame
member.summary: This class extends , implementing support for ID3v2 Comments (COMM) Frames.

remarks.para: A should be used for storing user readable comments on the media file.

When reading comments from a file, should be used as it gracefully falls back to comments that you, as a developer, may not be expecting. When writing comments, however, it is best to use as it forces it to be written in the exact version you are expecting.

member.name: M:TagLib.Id3v2.CommentsFrame.GetPreferred(TagLib.Id3v2.Tag,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Gets a specified comments frame from the specified tag, trying to to match the description and language but accepting an incomplete match.
member.param: A object to search in.
A specifying the description to match.
A specifying the ISO-639-2 language code to match.
member.returns: A object containing the matching frame, or if a match wasn't found.

remarks.para: The method tries matching with the following order of precidence:

item.term: The first frame with a matching description and language.
The first frame with a matching language.
The first frame with a matching description.
